results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI

results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI

results.title: Staying Connected
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet Stephen Giles, a Caramut local, who now lives and works in the city but remains connected to the town through the Caramut Football Club, which he started playing for when he was 8 years old. He is now a patron of the club, just like his father was, and has helped the community to keep it alive, recognising its importance to the locals. He even puts on the footy boots again to play in the Seniors League.

results.title: Looking Back
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
results.description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
description_for_label: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.

results.title: Tales from Caramut Footy
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Caramut Football Club brings the locals together and keeps the community spirit alive. Whether slogging it out on the field, helping out in the canteen or just cheering on from the sidelines, the locals appreciate their footy and as the community grows, it is a great place to catch up and stay connected.
results.description: The Caramut Football Club brings the locals together and keeps the community spirit alive. Whether slogging it out on the field, helping out in the canteen or just cheering on from the sidelines, the locals appreciate their footy and as the community grows, it is a great place to catch up and stay connected.

results.title: Stories from Yambuk Youth
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Five boys from Yambuk talk about what it means to be young in a small regional town and the various activities the town has to offer. They tell of the fun times growing up in the country, what they would like to change about the world and their ambitions for the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
